stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream debugging a crash, then shifts to heavy world-building for Course 14, a cardboard-and-craft themed stage. He prototypes textures, lighting tricks, and layout while discussing YouTube strategy, demo plans, and hardware limits.

development_findings.summary: A recent change inside a large function caused a hard crash; Kaze located the faulty "zero" scale index optimization suggested by chat and reverted it.
development_findings.quote: I will undo this optimization from chat – that’s where the crash was.

development_findings.summary: FPS in the reworked Course 1 regressed (game-loop time up ~0.5 ms); Kaze notes he "must have made changes" and will investigate later.
Course 14 will take place inside a giant paper cylinder with cardboard mountains, gift-wrap ‘water’, glue patches that kill jumps, and craft-material enemies such as scissors and rulers.
development_findings.quote: Everything is made out of cardboard and craft materials. It would make sense if this course was on a giant table, but I want a death floor, so I’m putting it inside a paper cylinder.

development_findings.summary: He added a fake rim-lighting/normal-map combiner to make painted walls shimmer when the camera moves; effect tuned by multiplying angle diff ×4.
development_findings.quote: Shiny paint – paint is always shiny – so when you turn the camera there’s highlights moving.

development_findings.summary: Performance concerns drive design choices: cotton-ball clouds and popsicle sticks are deemed ‘too high-poly’; he keeps overdraw low and renders an infinite PG room background with no Z-buffer first.
development_findings.quote: This level is going to be very difficult to make run well on N64 because of how open it is.

development_findings.summary: No boss planned for Course 14; a Mario-Paint-inspired retro section is likely.
Demo build requirements: Course 1 remake must be finished and performant before public demo.
development_findings.quote: Biobak is currently still working on the Course 1 remake – I want that to be in the demo.

development_findings.summary: Technical note: he disables the N64 divot feature most of the time; knows several hardware bugs he may cover in a future video.

context_findings.summary: Kaze considers YouTube the ‘job part’ and game development the fun part; he recently hired an external video editor.
context_findings.quote: For me, YouTube at this point is the job part and making the game is the fun part.

context_findings.summary: He’s excited that his latest video is outperforming expectations (80 % more views, possible 1 M hit) and is planning a slate of ~20 long-form videos.
context_findings.quote: This might be a 1 million view banger.

context_findings.summary: He avoids covering the Nintendo Giga-Leak to reduce legal risk and protect his channel.
context_findings.quote: I on purpose stayed away from the Giga-Leak … they’re already murdering my YouTube channel whenever I can.

context_findings.summary: Vacation ends in two days; returning to his non-YouTube job may reduce development time.
context_findings.quote: I just have three more days of vacation and then it’s back to work.

context_findings.summary: He experimented with ChatGPT-01 for coding help; found it ‘wrong a lot’ but still useful.

biobak.summary: Working on the Course 1 remake needed for the demo; also provides texture and background suggestions for Course 14 during the stream.
biobak.quote: Biobak is currently still working on the Course 1 remake – I want that to be in the demo.

key_stories.title: Optimization from chat crashes game
key_stories.summary: A viewer-suggested scale-index optimization introduced a crash. Kaze traced the fault, reverted the change, and restored stability.
key_stories.challenge: Hard crash inside a massive function after recent commits.
key_stories.process: Compared commit history, identified new scale-index logic, verified garbage values, and rolled back the change.
key_stories.outcome: Crash fixed; lesson not to merge unvetted chat optimizations.
key_stories.key_quote: I guess I have to fix that – I’ll just undo this optimization from chat.

key_stories.title: Building the cardboard course
key_stories.summary: Kaze prototypes Course 14, experimenting with glue surfaces, gift-wrap water, and a paper-cylinder skybox while juggling N64 performance limits.
key_stories.challenge: Create a visually rich craft-themed level that still runs on real N64 hardware.
key_stories.process: Iteratively tests textures, lighting tricks, and geometry; rejects high-poly ideas; designs death floor and scenery.
key_stories.outcome: Settled on paper cylinder walls with rim-light effect, gift-wrap floor, cardboard mountains, and planned cotton-clouds; next steps are layout and enemy scripting.
key_stories.key_quote: This level is going to be very difficult to make run well on N64 because of how open it is.

key_stories.title: YouTube success and new editor
key_stories.summary: Kaze’s latest video significantly outperforms previous uploads. He discusses content planning and reveals he hired an editor, freeing him to focus on development.
key_stories.challenge: Maintain channel growth while dedicating time to game development.
key_stories.process: Analyzes video metrics, drafts 20-video roadmap, delegates editing.
key_stories.outcome: Higher engagement video, clearer content pipeline, less personal editing workload.
key_stories.key_quote: Yes, I have an editor now — it’s not myself anymore.

open_questions.topic: Final treatment of Course 14 death floor
open_questions.context: Kaze is undecided between water, cotton balls, or other materials; worries players may think they can land on it.
questions: What solution did the team ultimately pick for the death floor?
How was the visual cue tested to ensure players understand it?

open_questions.context: FPS dropped after recent changes; Kaze noted game-loop time increase but didn’t debug further.
questions: What specific changes caused the slowdown?
What optimizations are planned before the demo?

open_questions.context: Kaze won’t make ‘Everyone was wrong about the N64’ video until he fully understands RSP; waiting on Sauraen.
questions: What breakthroughs has Sauraen achieved on RSP optimization?
How will these findings influence Return to Yoshi’s Island?

open_questions.context: Kaze wants Course 1 remake in the demo but gave no date.
questions: What remaining tasks gate the demo?
How will feedback from the demo be integrated?

open_questions.topic: Legal strategy for Missing Link re-release
open_questions.context: Nintendo previously issued a takedown; Kaze plans a future update.
questions: What precautions will be taken to avoid another takedown?

open_questions.context: Stream gave little information on Badub and Zeina’s current tasks.
questions: What is Badub composing right now?
What animations is Zeina focused on and how do they integrate with Course 14?
